ValueDomain.preferredName: Vital Signs Time Point Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A point in time that the vital signs assessment takes place._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A point in time that the vital signs assessment takes place.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What is the planned time poin
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.

ReferenceDocuments.name: VSTPT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors VSTPTREF (text description) and VSRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables VSTPTNUM, VSELTM.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the planned time point labels for vital signs, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
